channel.title: [tut] How to install texture packs the complicated way?[/tut]
channel.description:
For: MINECRAFT (v. Any really...) Skill level: 2 easy as making a mud pie after it rains
First off find the texture pack you want here : [code]http://www.minecraftforum.net/viewtopic.php?t=12352[/code]
::::NONE HD INSTRUCTIONS:::::
1 Next make a folder with a backup Minecraft.jar just incase you do it wrong or dislike the texture pack
2 name is BACKUPMINE
3 make another folder to contain the zip'd files i dont care what you name this one
4 Drag ONLY these listed files on to the Minecraft.jar in your roaming/.minecraft/bin folder (winrar may be needed to pack them into a jar file) - art - Gui (remove the arrow.png in it cuz it will f%%% up your game) - misc - terrain - Terrain.png - particles.png if you dont have some of the files in the texture pack you downloaded then thats fine. means it does not require the extra files
5 once done Start the game and your done ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::;; :::::::HD INSTRUCTIONS:::::::::: 1 Next make a folder with a backup Minecraft.jar just incase you do it wrong or dislike the texture pack
2 name is BACKUPMINE
3 make another folder to contain the zip'd files i dont care what you name this one
4 download this file [code]http://github.com/downloads/pclewis/mcpatcher/mcpatcher-1.1.12_02.exe[/code] and it will update your files to HD dont worry it only updates the reader part of minecraft so you can still go on moparscape's server it dont change the version type) after that is done...
5 Drag ONLY these listed files on to the Minecraft.jar in your roaming/.minecraft/bin folder (winrar may be needed to pack them into a jar file) - art - Gui (remove the arrow.png in it cuz it will f%%% up your game) - misc - terrain - Terrain.png - particles.png if you dont have some of the files in the texture pack you downloaded then thats fine. means it does not require the extra files
6 Run minecraft and see if you like.
END

item.title: [tut] How to install texture packs the complicated way?[/tut]
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

noobs are ftw:

Mironic ur being an idiot right now there’s a texture pack folder where u put the zip file in then u run ur client go to mods and texture packs and choose one u want and for hd u just gotta use the patched and then it same method of loading

this is for the people that have the free version, since the texture file dosent work unless you bought the game
ha i see, but im no idiot i do it the complex way XD

Read full topic

item.title: [tut] How to install texture packs the complicated way?[/tut]
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

For: MINECRAFT (v. Any really…)
Skill level: 2 easy as making a mud pie after it rains

First off find the texture pack you want here :

::::NONE HD INSTRUCTIONS:::::

1 Next make a folder with a backup Minecraft.jar just incase you do it wrong or dislike the texture pack

2 name is BACKUPMINE

3 make another folder to contain the zip’d files i dont care what you name this one

4 Drag ONLY these listed files on to the Minecraft.jar in your roaming/.minecraft/bin folder (winrar may be needed to pack them into a jar file)
- art
- Gui (remove the arrow.png in it cuz it will f%%% up your game)
- misc
- terrain
- Terrain.png
- particles.png
if you dont have some of the files in the texture pack you downloaded then thats fine. means it does not require the extra files

5 once done Start the game and your done
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::;;
:::::::HD INSTRUCTIONS::::::::::
1 Next make a folder with a backup Minecraft.jar just incase you do it wrong or dislike the texture pack

2 name is BACKUPMINE

3 make another folder to contain the zip’d files i dont care what you name this one

4 download this file http://github.com/downloads/pclewis/mcpatcher/mcpatcher-1.1.12_02.exe
and it will update your files to HD dont worry it only updates the reader part of minecraft so you can still go on
moparscape’s server it dont change the version type)
after that is done…

5 Drag ONLY these listed files on to the Minecraft.jar in your roaming/.minecraft/bin folder (winrar may be needed to pack them into a jar file)
- art
- Gui (remove the arrow.png in it cuz it will f%%% up your game)
- misc
- terrain
- Terrain.png
- particles.png
if you dont have some of the files in the texture pack you downloaded then thats fine. means it does not require the extra files

6 Run minecraft and see if you like.

END
